intro: Turraea kindtii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
